content.description:
Samples of <math alttext="S O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>SO</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>, <math alttext="O 2, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math>, and <math alttext="S O 3, gas" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>SO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>g</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded></math> are placed in a previously evacuated reaction vessel and allowed to react according to the following equation.

<math alttext="2 S O 2, gas, plus O 2, gas, is in equilibrium with 2 S O 3, gas" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mi>SO</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> <mo>+</mo> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mpadded> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> <mo>⇄</mo> <mn>2</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <msub> <mi>SO</mi> <mn>3</mn> </msub> </mpadded> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <mpadded> <mi>g</mi> </mpadded> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </math> 

<math alttext="K sub p equals, 2.5 times 10 to the negative 2 power at 896 kelvin" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>K</mi> <mi>p</mi> </msub> <mo>=</mo> <mn>2.5</mn> <mo>×</mo> <msup> <mn>10</mn> <mpadded> <mo>-</mo> <mn>2</mn> </mpadded> </msup> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>at</mi> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mn>896</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mtext>K</mtext> </math>

In the vessel, initially <math alttext="P sub S O 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi>SO</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub></math> is <math alttext="4.0 atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mn>4.0</mn><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>, <math alttext="P sub O 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub></math> is <math alttext="10, decimal point, atmospheres" overflow="scroll"><mn>10</mn><mtext>.</mtext><mspace width="0.25em"></mspace><mi>atm</mi></math>, and <math alttext="P sub S O 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi>SO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></msub></math> is <math alttext="2.0 atmospheres" overflow="scroll"> <mn>2.0</mn> <mspace width="0.25em"> </mspace> <mi>atm</mi> </math>.
content.question: If the temperature is held constant, which of the following predicts what will happen to <math alttext="P sub O 2" overflow="scroll"> <msub> <mi>P</mi> <msub> <mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </msub> </math> when the reaction occurs and best explains why?

choices.label: <math alttext="P sub O 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub></math> will increase, because <math alttext="K sub p is less than 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>K</mi><mi>p</mi></msub><mo><</mo><mn>1</mn></math>.

<math alttext="P sub O 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub></math> will decrease, because the total number of moles of reactants is less than the number of moles of product, and the reaction will proceed to form more product.

<math alttext="P sub O 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub></math> will decrease, because the initial <math alttext="P sub S O 3" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi>SO</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></msub></math> is lowest, and the reaction will proceed in the forward direction.
<math alttext="P sub O 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub></math> will not change, because the system is already at equilibrium.

content.answer: <math alttext="P sub O 2" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>P</mi><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">O</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></msub></math> will not change, because the system is already at equilibrium.

skill.text: 5.F: Calculate, estimate, or predict an unknown quantity from known quantities by selecting and following a logical computational pathway and attending to precision (e.g., performing dimensional analysis and attending to significant figures).
